Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2008 08:47AM - edited Apr 25, 2008 08:48AM by lemonld Mickey, I too have recently been told that my cancer had came back.  They found mine when they removed to lesion/tumors from my mast site and they came back poisitive with cancer cells.  My onc started me on Xeloda (2wk on 1 wk off) and we awaiting apporval for Avastin.  One week later I found a swollen lymph node around my collar bone and went back to onc.  He started me on Taxotere on 4/23/08 and I plan on fighting this until my last breath.  No one knows when anyone is going to die and the only one who does, God, he's not sharing it with us.  I just read a post on here from a woman who is a 10+ survivor and has mets.  Remember we are all here for you and I will keep you in my prayers...don't give up...FIGHT!  Make a liar out of that onc...OK! Hugs, Linda
Posts.Title: 2nd round mickey1 JoyRebecca

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 07:34PM - edited Apr 23, 2008 07:49PM by lemonld
Posts.Title: Good news in rain of bad! lemonld lemonld

Posts.Content: lemonld wrote: Today I saw my onc after just seeing him last week.  We discussed last week the issue that my bc had mets to skin.  He wanted to start me on Xeloda 3600mg @ day along with using an IV therapy Avastin.  Well I had decided to get a second opinion and not to take the drugs.  But low and behold I found another spot near my neck along with swelling, I also passed out in the middle of the kitchen floor early Mon. morning around 12:45am with vomiting.  Called onc on Mon. told his nurse that I had started taking the Xeloda, had passed out, and had found another spot within the week that I had last seen him.  She called back later and told me that onc wanted me to have MRI of brain Monday night and a bone scan on Tue and see me Tues afternoon.  Well for the GOOD NEWS, no mets to brain or bone....YEE HAW!  Still do not know why I passed out..maybe stress he said.  The bad news is that he wants to start Taxotere tomorrow and we'll see how the tumors in the skin react. Pray for me....I know that this will probably not be cured but maybe just maybe I can live a longer life and have time to be with my husband hopefully become a grandmother. Thanks for listening and God Bless you all! Linda Dx 3/30/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 9/23 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Good news in rain of bad! lemonld lemonld

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2008 08:16PM - edited Oct 28, 2008 08:18PM by lemonld Stephanie, I too get thrush from chemo txs.  It makes not want to eat or drink since nothing taste good, everything is the same.  My onc prescribed nystatin and dyflucan also, i use the nystatin the day b4 a tx and for about a week after and the dyflcan I take everyday, twice a day, and it does work. Also, you keep posting whatever you want, that's what we are here for, your cyber family, sometimes it's easier to b**ch and complain to us than to friends and family and that is perfectly fine. Hope you find something that will help with the thrush as it is disgusting and as you said who cares if you eat.  Hang in there and we will be praying for you. Hugs, Linda
Posts.Title: Thrush...... Yuk! TripleNeg lemonld

Posts.Content: May 13, 2008 11:20PM - edited May 13, 2008 11:21PM by lemonld Hezzy, I too got neuropathy from the Taxol when I took it during my first round of chemo.  My onc told me it could take up to six months to clear and if not improved by then it might never go away.  I took Vitaman E6 (200IU) and Vitamin B12 (not sure of dosage).  These did seem to help, the neuropathy went away in my hands and my left foot, my right foot was still alittle sore where the toes hook onto the foot.  I find that wearing flip flop or crocks do help, something that is not tight on the foot.  I am now on Xeloda (3600 mg/daily) and this can cause hand/foot syndrome, my onc put me on Vitamin6 (50 mg) 4xdaily.  I did quit taking the vitamin B12, but still take the vitaminE, try these and see how they work.  Make sure you check with onc before doing this as I did. Good luck I know how it feels, also as an FYI in the winter time my feet would get very sore when they got cold and I purchased a pair of Happy Feet house shoes and they were wonderful, didn't leave home with them.  They can be purchased on line at www.buyhappyfeet.com if you are interested. Hope this is of some help! Hugs, Linda
Posts.Title: neuropathy??? hezzy Sierra

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2008 07:16PM - edited Sep 4, 2008 07:17PM by lemonld Sunny, I am currently receiving Taxotere every three weeks.  This last tx I finally received a full dose.  The only side effects I get from the Taxotere is fatigue by the end of the week.  I receive my tx on Wed. and work the rest of the week.  I am usually laid up until Tues and I go back to work.  It takes a few days to get my strength back but by the following weekend I am doing pretty good (who knows what normal is anymore) so I don't say back to normal.  In this time frame I usually have some issues with my mouth such as yeasty coating on tongue and mouth and throat being sore, but manageable.  Now when I was on the Xeloda and the Taxotere my life was hell.  My onc finally took me off of the Xeloda and I had scans done in August after 4 rounds of Xeloda and 6 rounds of Taxotere and they showed NED! so the drugs do work.  I hope everything goes well for you but remember to let your onc know about any side effects because he can adjust the dosage on both drugs.  The Xeloda made me more tired, nauseous, sore hands and feet, mouth sores and throat, just wore out.  I couldn't eat or drink and just wanted to stop tx, that's when the onc took me off of the Xeloda. I wish you good luck on your tx and also wish you a Happy Anniversary.  Even though you will be receiving tx that day you can still celebrate that 1st anniversary, make each day count. Hugs, Linda
Posts.Title: Here we go again sunny365 sunny365

Posts.Content: lemonld wrote: Today I went to Siteman Cancer Center in St. Louis, MO for a second opinion.  Since my bc had came back after 4 months of A/C&T and 33 rads I just needed to hear someone elses opinion.  I saw Dr. Loren Michels and he told me that was my onc did and was doing would have been exactly what he would have done and would do.  He also stated that with 9 lymph nodes positive that the cancer would have returned, which I already knew.  So I will continue with the Xeloda (3600 mg/daily) and Taxotere every three weeks. I have already done 1 cycle of Xeloda and started 2 and had one tx of Taxotere with next today at 9:00am.  I did have MRI of brain, Bone scan, CT Scan, and PET Scan and all came back with no mets to any organs or brain. WOOHOO!  The bc is in the skin on the mast site and has moved to lymph nodes in the neck. I ask that you please pray for me and I will most assuredly pray for all of you.  Also thought I would interject here that I have started to lose my hair again!  Well it was nice while it last, I have went without hat's or bandana's (hated wig) since Jan and here I go again. As a FYI I go have a blog at caring bridge which you can get to from my profile if anyone is interested. Thanks again to those who take the time to read my post and give me words of encouragement when I really need it most. Hugs! Linda Dx 3/30/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 9/23 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Also ladies thanks for the encouraging words! Thanks, Linda

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2008 07:52AM - edited Jun 23, 2008 07:53AM by lemonld Deb. I also got a sore throat after my 2nd tx of Taxotere along with sores in the mouth.  My onc gave me a lower dose the next tx and that helped.  I told him I thought he was trying to kill me.  I couldn't eat or drink without terrible pain.  He even gave me liquid morphine to use one hour before I ate and that didn't even help.  So I'm sure that this is probably a side effect of the chemo. You know that 99% of what we worry about never comes to fruition, and the other 1% we can't do anything about to stop, except deal with it. Hang in there and don't borrow trouble. Hugs, Linda
Posts.Title: Avastin/Taxol and sore throat AlaskaDeb Roja1955

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 08:03PM - edited Apr 23, 2008 08:04PM by lemonld Diane, I know that feeling of being indecisive...but I agree there is no right or wrong answer.  Go with your gut feeling.  I was dx with skin mets on 4/14/08 and my onc suggested Xeloda and Avasti n.  I was going to get 2nd opinion but found another lump and stated the Xeloda.  We have also decided to add Taxotere (which in is the Taxol family, which I have already had).  Hopefully this will work. Just talk to your onc and if you have that trust in him/her you will both feel better about the decision that you make.  Best of luck and I will be praying for you. Hugs, Linda
Posts.Title: Made a decision....I think? :o) badboob67 Kasey

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 09:50PM lemonld wrote: Donna, I was diagnosed with skin mets.  I had two areas that were removed and they have tested positive with cancer cells.  The first one I found was about the size of a pea under the skin and it rolled around.  My surgeon just thought it was a cyst and he said if it got bigger or bothered me he would remove it.  In March I saw my onc and he said to get it removed, it had gotten bigger and had a reddish-purple color to it.  I called my surgeon to get it removed and the day I was to have this one removed I found another pea sized knot under the skin in another area he removed it also.  Both of mine were on the chest where I had mastectomy. Make sure he checks them out...never be sorry you push the issue...it;s your life not his.  Good luck and I will keep you in my prayers. Hugs, Linda
Posts.Title: Skin Mets donnaakadj Bmarie

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2008 08:17PM - edited Jun 12, 2008 08:17PM by lemonld I am currently on Taxotere (every third week) and Xeloda 2900 mg daily (2 wks on/1 wk off).  I have had three tx of both.  The first two were higher strength than than the last one.  When on the higher strength I got mouth sore in mouth and throat and could not eat anything, had to have IV fluids for three days until I could eat.  This last tx my onc reduced the dosage and I have done better.  I have not gotten any mouth sore but at times I am very tired even though I continue to work full-time.  Still have a hard time eating because everything taste the same and I force myself to eat.  I do have some nausea but I take Zofran for that. I wish your wife well and if you or her have any questions you can send me a personal email or ask in this thread.  You are in our prayers. HUGS, Linda
Posts.Title: its my wife CIPRO117 LumiPojo

Posts.Content: lemonld wrote: I am currently taking Xeloda 2900 mg each day (2wks on 1wk off) and receive Taxotere every three weeks.  I have one week that I do not do any chemo (pills or IV) and I seem to be able to eat.  But when I start the Xeloda on Tuesday and get Taxotere on Wednesday by the end of the week and all through the next week I don't want to eat.  Everything taste terrible or the same and I force myself to eat what I do.  My mouth does get somewhat irritated (only had sores after on tx and had to receive IV fluids because I couldn't swallow for three days).  I currently take nystatin, dyflucan, and rinse my mouth with prevention and biotene.  Help, does anyone have the same problem nothing sounds good. Posts.Content: May 16, 2008 12:22PM - edited May 16, 2008 12:23PM by lemonld Diane, I take 3600 mg per day, this my second cyle (2wks on/1wk off).  Side effects are fatigue, some tingly burning in feet but hands seems to be okay.  I do not have mouth sores but my mouth does feel raw and hurts into my second week on the pills.  Some of these SE could be from the Taxotere since I receive and infusion on Wed after I start the Xeloda on Sat.  I didn't ask my onc if this was by weight or just standard protocol. But I will most certainly ask him.  I do know that if you have to may SE they can consider doing one wk on/1 wk off. He had considered reducing, but it seems to be skrinking the lymph node swelling in my neck so he wanted to leave it one more week.  He was concerned about my not eating when mouth hurt.  Hugs, Linda

Posts.Title: CT Scan - Stable! KariLynn candie1971

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2008 09:27PM lemonld wrote: I agree with Hanna you need to make sure that you are not dehydrated.  I have had to have IV fluids five times in the last four weeks.  The first time was because of mouth sores and in the throat I couldn't eat or drink.  The last two times I had my onc visit and the nurse said I needed IV fluids.  I told onc I felt like s**t once I was given the fluids in a matter of hours I felt much better.  I know it's hard but as others have said you just had major surgery.  Accept the help from others and DO NOT take a shower alone as suggest maybe get a shower stool to sit on but the exertion alone will wear you out.  As my surgeon told me when I said how tired I was but I wanted to get back to work, he reminded me that I had just had three surgeries in the last four weeks.  It takes time and I know that you are tired of feeling sick and tired, but take it easy and try to eat and drink what you can, remember smaller meals through out the day are better that nothing.  I will keep you in my prayers. Hugs, Linda

I was taken off of the Xeloda in June due to the toxicity of the drug and remain on the Taxotere with good results.  Good luck with your tx and remember we are here to help...just ask....as I tell my college students "There are no dumb questions, only the ones you don't ask"! Posts.Title: New to this forum! CarmenA AusAla

Posts.Content: lemonld wrote: I went to see my primary yesterday because I had this pain right below the chest bone and always felt like I was full.  I thought it was my gall bladder since every time I have a CT it show I have gall stones.  I was sent today for an ultrasound of the gall bladder and then had a CT done because they saw something suspicious on the liver.  Well I just got the results and I have at least 10 lesions ranging in the size of 1-5 cm and on lesion in the lateral segment left hepatic lobe and measures 12.4 X 6.4 cm.  My liver enzymes went from 193 on 11/12 to 500 on 11/17.  Imagine my shock since in Aug there was nothing in the liver.  I am triple negative and have been going through chemo (taxotere) since 4/08 for local recurrence in the mastectomy site.  I go to see my onc tomorrow to discuss this but my question for all of you is what kind of chemo did you take for liver mets, any help would be greatly appreciated.  Also did I mention I HATE THIS DISEASE!!!!! Thanks, Linda Dx 3/30/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 9/23 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

So sorry that onc is leaving it up to you, he/she should tell you what they feel is the best and then leave it up to you to decide after you research. Good luck and I'll be praying for you.
